name: Simulating birth and death
tagline: Software for simulating birth and death processes for big particle ensembles
body:
### Welcome to our project page!

The goal of the project is allowing simulations wide class of birth and death processes in a microdynamic regime. These can be seen as a system of interacting particles where possible events include creation of new particle(birth) or removal of an existing one (death).
The occurrence of the events is dependent on every particle and can be either deterministic or stochastic.

Please note that jumps (i.e. moving a particle from one place to another in a discrete moment) or changing particles' properties is a combination of both death and birth, and is also supported by the program.

Out of many, possible applications include biological cell dynamics (cancer evolution, pattern formation), ecology (spreading of species), models from statistical physics or mathematics.

The software can be considered as a pilot study for a forthcoming simulation framework for a tumor evolution and is developed as a part of the cooperation between Bielefeld University and [Wrocław University of Technology](http://www.pwr.wroc.pl), of simulating of interacting particle systems in continuum and application in cell dynamics. 


### Main goals
* Graphical User Interface (GUI) for easy computation
* Command Line Interface (CLI) for running advanced experiments
* continuous space and time (up to the numerical precision)
* 2D and 3D space in GUI or any-dimensional space in CLI
* various models with different levels of generality 
* low memory footprint, overall efficiency
* available for Windows, Linux and other compatible operating systems

### Project status - ongoing development
* GUI subproject reached early version (see [screenshots](https://github.com/biel-wro/SimBaD/wiki/GUI-Screenshots) )
* CLI is only available in old version   

Some example results produced by the software can be viewed [here](https://github.com/biel-wro/SimBaD/wiki/Pattern-formation)

### Build requirements
* cmake
* C++ compiler with C++11 support (tested on g++ 4.8)
* boost 1.54
* Qt5 (GUI)
Project is built with cmake in the standard procedure. More details can be found [here](https://github.com/biel-wro/SimBaD/wiki/Building-SimBaD).

### Authors
**Mykola Lebid**
* Membership: Since 2012 PhD student, International Graduate College "Stochastics and Real World Models", Bielefeld University, Germany.
* Research interests: Interactive particle systems; Probability theory; Fractal analysis

**Tomasz Ożański**
* PhD Student in Computer Science on Faculty of Electronics at Wrocław University of Technology, Poland 
* research interests: computational complexity, meta-programing, interacting particle systems simulations

### Literature
Further information on theory Interacting Particle Systems in Continuum (IPSC) can be found in [the publication](http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs12080-013-0202-8):

 _A general mathematical framework for the analysis of spatiotemporal point processes_, Ovaskainen, Otso and Finkelshtein, Dmitri and Kutoviy, Oleksandr and Cornell, Stephen and Bolker, Benjamin and Kondratiev, Yuri, 

or in presentations on [Yuri Kondratiev](www.math.uni-bielefeld.de/~kondrat/) homepage
* Birth-and-death in continuum: constructive aspects - [link](http://www.math.uni-bielefeld.de/~kondrat/Presentations/1.pdf)
* Interacting Particle systems in Continuum: Continuous vs. Discrete - [link](http://www.math.uni-bielefeld.de/~kondrat/Presentations/3.pdf)
* Spatial Markov Processes in Mutation-Selection Models - [link](http://www.math.uni-bielefeld.de/~kondrat/Presentations/4.pdf)
* Kinetic equations from Markov evolutions in continuum - [link](http://www.math.uni-bielefeld.de/~kondrat/Presentations/5.pdf)


### Support or Contact
For information regarding graphical user interface and building the windows version please contact the authors Mykola Lebid (@mykolalebid) and Tomasz Ożański(@tozanski).
